projects.title: DetectBot
projects.description: DetectBot is a Twitter Bot that utilizes machine and deep learning capabilities to detect image manipulation on tweets. Gained 150,000+ impressions post-launch, 12,000+ profile visits, & 100+ Bot uses winning us the award of Most Impactful Team in the Uber Global Hackathon, and is a project that is continuously worked on. DetectBot is based on the ManTraNet. It uses a TensorFlow backend, with Keras serving as a high-level neural network library, making it user-friendly. It uses two sub-networks: an Image Manipulation Trace Feature Extractor, which is sensitive to different manipulation techniques and encodes the location of image manipulation into a fixed dimension feature vector, and a Local Anomaly Detection Network, which compares the dominant feature averaged from a local region to a local feature, indicating signs of image manipulation based on the deviation from the reference feature. It has been hosted in an AWS Cloud Server, with an open-source on GitHub.

name: Angie Howard
about:
The greatest opportunity space for AI isn‚Äôt in what we can touch‚Äîit‚Äôs in how we can teach machines to learn and adapt. For the last ten years, I‚Äôve been building at the frontier of voice AI, most recently as the Founding Engineer of a startup that was acquired by Salesforce.

I love learning and solving gnarly problems with impact. I thrive in 0‚Äì>1 environments where there is room to invent, build, and shape the direction from the ground up.

My sweet spot is setting strategy and leading technical teams at the edge of what‚Äôs next.

recommendations: Esteban Ordo√±ez ‚ÄúI had the privilege of working closely with Frances during their tenure as a lead instructor at Fullstack Academy, where I served as a Mentor. Frances was responsible for guiding a diverse cohort of over 30 students through an intensive fullstack web development curriculum, which included HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, SQL, and essential tech interviewing skills. Frances's approach to instruction was truly commendable. They consistently demonstrated an exceptional level of empathy and patience when working one-on-one with students, many of whom came from nontraditional backgrounds and were transitioning from roles at companies like Amazon. Their ability to connect with each student on a personal level fostered an environment of trust and collaboration within the classroom. What stood out to me most about Frances was their unwavering positivity and their willingness to go above and beyond to support their colleagues and students alike. They approached every challenge with a solution-oriented mindset and were always eager to share their extensive knowledge and expertise in software engineering. I wholeheartedly endorse Frances for any software engineering position. Their combination of technical proficiency, interpersonal skills, and genuine passion for education make them an invaluable asset to any team. Frances's dedication to empowering others and their natural ability to inspire those around them make them a standout candidate in the field of software engineering. It was truly a pleasure to work alongside Frances, and I have no doubt that they will continue to excel in their future endeavors.‚Äù

Glenda R. ‚ÄúThrough shared connections, I heard of Frances as a leader in software engineering promoting females and diversity in tech. I‚Äôm a seasoned developer, with a similar background, re-entering the field. So, when I noticed that she was offering mentoring calls, I immediately signed up. During our time, Frances provided valuable insights into current hiring processes. She shared excellent tips for crafting a resume and updating my LinkedIn profile. Additionally, she provided resources for further education and job postings. Frances‚Äô knowledge is both focused and wide-reaching, following the current market trends. She was also very supportive and encouraged me to regain my confidence to grow in my career path. I highly recommend Frances to anyone looking for a mentor.‚Äù

experience.title: Founder, Head of Operations
experience.description: Hayward Collegiate is a free, open admission public charter school for the students and families of Hayward, California. We firmly believe that an excellent education is the best path to achieving self-determination. As the Head of Operations, I managed all administrative functions, including developing and implementing school-wide systems and procedures relating to procurement, compliance tracking, safety, facilities, IT, payroll and HR, and the school meal program. I also worked to define the values and culture of the organization with the Executive Director, including incorporating values into the hiring process and teacher professional development. Prior to the school year, I designed and managed the first fundraiser for the school, raising $10K through partnerships with local shops, organizations, and a collaborative community mural.Our mission: Through rigorous academics and individualized support, Hayward Collegiate prepares all students, from TK-6th grade, to lead lives of promise and opportunity. We prepare our scholars to have agency over their lives.

experience.title: Associate Industrial Engineer
experience.description: As an Associate Industrial Engineer for Disney Cruise Line, I enjoyed every moment of my role and the ability to create happiness for our Guests. Supporting the Disney Fantasy ships, my team led the integration of and created mitigation plans for over 100 dry dock schedules. Part of my role was to optimizie the stateroom schedule to minimize the number of room changes for 1400 DCL Cast Members and contractors living on the Disney Fantasy during the installation of carpet and bathtubs. With the the team, I also developed concise and intuitive visualizations in Photoshop and AUTOCAD to bridge language and cultural barriers between over 20+ companies from 10 countries.On the Disney Wonder, my team led scheduling, logistics, and risk management for 20 project team members and 2500 contractors in Cadiz, Spain during the 6-week dry dock, the largest dry dock in cruise line history. In the role, I earned the Disney Excellence Award for outstanding performance.In my role supporting Disney's Water Parks and Resorts, I evaluated the capacity and demand for pool towels at Value and Moderate Resorts across Disney property and partnered with finance and textile services to forecast operational costs and feasibility. One of the most interesting projects was supporting project development of a new family slide at Disney‚Äôs Typhoon Lagoon water park through capacity and demand analysis and queuing theory.
experience.description_html:
As an Associate Industrial Engineer for Disney Cruise Line, I enjoyed every moment of my role and the ability to create happiness for our Guests. Supporting the Disney Fantasy ships, my team led the integration of and created mitigation plans for over 100 dry dock schedules. Part of my role was to optimizie the stateroom schedule to minimize the number of room changes for 1400 DCL Cast Members and contractors living on the Disney Fantasy during the installation of carpet and bathtubs. With the the team, I also developed concise and intuitive visualizations in Photoshop and AUTOCAD to bridge language and cultural barriers between over 20+ companies from 10 countries.

On the Disney Wonder, my team led scheduling, logistics, and risk management for 20 project team members and 2500 contractors in Cadiz, Spain during the 6-week dry dock, the largest dry dock in cruise line history. In the role, I earned the Disney Excellence Award for outstanding performance.

In my role supporting Disney's Water Parks and Resorts, I evaluated the capacity and demand for pool towels at Value and Moderate Resorts across Disney property and partnered with finance and textile services to forecast operational costs and feasibility. One of the most interesting projects was supporting project development of a new family slide at Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon water park through capacity and demand analysis and queuing theory.

projects.title: Senior Design
projects.description: Like many healthcare centers, Emory Endocrinology often finds that both doctors and patients are dissatisfied due to excessive wait times. This can lead to higher doctor turnover or result in the decrease of quality of care of a patient. Utilizing stochastic appointment scheduling optimization, our team created improved schedules to balance the tradeoff between customer and doctor satisfaction. We employed the simulation software Simio to assess the current processes in the Endocrinology center, including what occurs during patient-doctor interaction. The center had difficulty quantifying how much time was spent between when the doctor should have seen a patient and when they actually saw a patient. By applying the new schedules and approaching the problem with a genetic algorithm and simulation, we were able to accomplish reduced waiting times and improved quality of care.

projects.title: Women in Engineering Seating Algorithm
projects.description: Women in Engineering (WIE) at Georgia Tech hosts an annual scholarship banquet attended by approximately 500 students, faculty, and company sponsors. All women at Georgia Tech who hold over a 3.0 GPA are invited to attend and a select few are awarded scholarships from companies. To benefit students, faculty, and companies, students must be seated with companies or faculty that correspond to their majors. In addition, companies have requirements based on GPA and Citizenship which must be met. In previous years, this was done manually and took about 3 weeks to seat all attendees. Any changes to the list of RSVPs had to be handled manually as well. I wrote a seating algorithm which takes in all of the requirements of attendees from Excel files and outputs a seating plan in a matter of minutes.

organizations.title: Acts of Kindness
organizations.description: Too often we are apathetic because we can‚Äôt be bothered due to time, financial, and emotional constraints. At the same time, we have an inexplicable wish to change the world. At AoK, we believe that small acts of kindness have an immeasurable impact on the lives of others. Our mission is to foster a spirit of service in the Georgia Tech community by inspiring students to perform acts of kindness each and every day.

organizations.title: Omicron Delta Kappa Leadership Honor Society
organizations.description: Omicron Delta Kappa places emphasis upon the development of the whole person, both as a present member of the college community and as a prospective contributor to a better society. The society believes that while good scholarship and intellectual development are the chief objectives of the college years, the life of the mind is not the only life students will have to cope with as the result of their college experience. There are also important lessons and personal qualities, which one learns and develops through an integrated program of academic and extracurricular education. The founders of ODK formulated the idea that leadership of exceptional quality and versatility in college should be recognized, that representatives in all phases of college life should cooperate in a worthwhile endeavor, and that outstanding students, faculty, and administration members should meet on a basis of mutual interest, understanding, and helpfulness.

about:
üë©‚Äçüíª Passionate First-Generation Latina in STEM | Computer Science Enthusiast üöÄ

üåü About Me:
I am a first-generation Latina with a boundless curiosity for the world of technology and its profound impact on our rapidly evolving society.

üîç My Journey:
From a young age, I've been captivated by the ever-advancing world of technology. What began as a fascination with the devices that surround us evolved into a deep-seated passion for the inner workings of the digital realm. üåê

üåÜ From Architectural Dreams to Tech Realities:
Initially, I envisioned a career in architecture, driven by a desire to create tangible structures. However, my perspective shifted dramatically when I embarked on my first programming course. It was then that I realized my true calling lay in building within the digital landscape. üíª

üåü Tech Passions:
Web development, software engineering, and data analysis are where I find my most profound passions converge. These fields embody the perfect blend of creativity, problem-solving, and the freedom to deconstruct and refine code to optimize solutions.

üõ†Ô∏è Specialties:
I thrive in rapidly learning new skills, adeptly tackling challenges, multitasking effectively, paying meticulous attention to detail, and embracing the opportunity to master new programming languages. üõ°Ô∏è

üå± Eternal Learner:
I'm a firm believer that learning is a lifelong journey, and I eagerly seek out new opportunities to expand my skill set and broaden my horizons. üìö

üöÄ Let's Connect:
I am excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, industry professionals, and collaborators who share my passion for innovation and the limitless possibilities that the world of computer science offers. Let's embark on this exciting journey together! üë•

name: Casey Olsen
about:
My mission as a professional is to make a positive impact on the world through accessible and practical technical applications. What excites me about technology is the rapid growth in the field and the potential to contribute to people‚Äôs everyday lives. I believe that many pertinent issues in today‚Äôs society can be solved by empathy, understanding and innovative solutions. 

My educational background of a Bachelors of Computer Science from UCLA and current pursuit of a Masters of Computer Science at Columbia University gives me the foundation to address a wide breadth of technical problems. In my pursuit of these degrees I have gained both theoretical and technical experience that lends directly to real world applications. My experience in industry as an intern at a number of different companies in the past few years has allowed me to explore different roles and I dabbled in data science and statistical analysis at Falkonry, explored test automation at Visa, machine learning at Sparta Science and fullstack mobile engineering at Uber. subjects within software engineering that have all made me a better developer. 

I believe my roles in various clubs and organizations and my experiences as a lifelong athlete, have given me the communication and leadership experience to be a valuable asset in the workplace. As president of the UCLA Women‚Äôs Club Volleyball team and Philanthropy Chair of the UCLA Club Sports Executive Council, I gained experience leading a large organization and learned the importance of teamwork.

I made full stack mobile changes to implement the feature for Android (Java), iOS (Swift) and the backend (Golang). I completed this feature end-to-end from drafting the proposal, to creating unit tests, to creating a rollout plan. This migration to another platform reduced the need for 5,000+ lines of redundant code and opened new opportunities for the experience in the future.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
experience.description: I built a Python-based edge application for executing human movement assessment tests on a force plate system. The software guides a user through tests while collecting time series data and then extracts key metrics. I developed machine learning models for activity classification and movement metric regression in Python. I built a MacOS application in Swift to demonstrate porting Python-based movement health models to CoreML and performed test-retest reliability analysis on movement health metrics using ICC.

I never envisioned myself working as a Software Engineer until one day I found myself taking a C++ coding class. As the semester went on, I enjoyed the class, I found it fun to make small programs that I could visually see execute (even as simple as multiplying and printing a number to the terminal). Once I began registering for my next semesters classes, I realized that I was bummed out I wouldn‚Äôt be taking another coding class, so I did what any person would do. Changed my major to Computer Science and began taking classes I enjoyed.

Fast forward to now, I am working at Netflix. I am currently a part of the Online Data Stores team working on Distributed Systems.

name: Steven Bui
position: IT Support Technician @ UCSC | Software Engineer, Fullstack Developer | CE BS @UCSC 2023
about:
I'm a Computer Engineering graduate from the University of California, Santa Cruz (UCSC) with strong interest for software development and its potential to drive positive change. Fluent in languages such as Python, C++, and JavaScript, I bring both adaptability and depth to my coding endeavors.

At UCSC's Humanities Computing Services, I dedicated over two years to tech support, exemplifying a blend of technical proficiency, organizational skills, and clear communication. As the lead technician for the Apple repair program, I oversaw the diagnosis and repair of 100+ Apple devices, streamlined technician training, pioneered process documentation, and established an informational website for team continuity. My efforts further extended to enrolling and deploying computing systems for the Humanities division, emphasizing my commitment to operational optimization.

My portfolio also boasts web development projects like designing an intuitive website to locate capybaras and implementing key features in an asset management system. From configuring LEDs for Morse code transmission to developing a 6ft tracker for COVID-19 safety using OpenCV, my projects underline my passion for blending software with real-world utility.

As I venture into the next chapter, I'm keen to embrace roles in software or fullstack development, employing my skills and soaking in insights from industry veterans. With a foundation that spans technical support, software development, and personal projects, I am poised to contribute to, and grow within, the dynamic landscape of tech.

recommendations: Kim Hwe ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of supervising Steven in his role as an IT Support Technician for the Humanities Division at the University of California, Santa Cruz. He joined our team in 2021, a pivotal year for us as we transitioned to a hybrid work model. Steven's ability to adapt quickly and his eagerness to contribute were apparent from the start. In the midst of this transition to the "new normal", Steven's willingness to assist, rapid learning, and collaborative nature were invaluable. He helped set up a number of DTEN teleconferencing units on his first day, efficiently handled support tickets in ServiceNow, and provided both in-person and remote support for over 350 faculty and 50 staff members. Additionally, Steven served as an Apple repair technician for our campus repair program, ensuring faculty members across the UC Santa Cruz campus had fully functioning Mac laptops. What truly stood out was Steven's unwavering commitment to providing outstanding customer service. He approached every interaction with kindness and a genuine desire to leave a positive impression. Steven's unique combination of approachability, willingness to lend a hand, and technical proficiency make him a standout team member. I have no doubt that he will excel in any role he takes on. It is with genuine enthusiasm that I recommend Steven to any organization fortunate enough to bring him on board.‚Äù

projects.title: DiversityGPT
projects.description: https://github.com/AmeerArsala/ai-clinician-trainerhttp://www.diversitygpt.xyz/https://anre-research.netlify.app/Designed for Stanford Medicine, DiversityGPT uses Machine Learning LLM technology in order to simulate patients from diverse backgrounds, accurately considering their backgrounds and dialects -- a mission in which most Language AI's fail to accurately depict.DiversityGPT (or its future name variant) is planned to be utilized for clinician training, and is to be extended forward to serve as a cultural competency training goto. It as well has many other use cases, as you are able to choose prompts for things other than medicinal diagnoses.Work in progress. Stay tuned to see where Stanford and ANRE Research (our independent organization) can reach with diversity research!

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: ‚Ä¢	Developed a robust Driver Rejection Visibility Tool using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL, enhancing visibility into driver rejection processes for 1,000+ drivers daily and reducing operational team efforts by 30% per shipment‚Ä¢	Created the Add-Consolidation-Weight Tool using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL, enabling the operations team to add 'consolidation weight' to cargo, leading to a 1% profit increase for 55% of shipments, positively impacting company revenue‚Ä¢	Engineered an AMS (Amsterdam Warehouse) Email Scraper using Ruby on Rails, automating milestone confirmation for shipments at the Amsterdam warehouse and saving 2+ hours per shipment for warehouse users‚Ä¢	Automated confirmation of receipt and departure milestones for over 1,000 Apple shipments daily with Cargo Batch Massive Operation Automation, reducing delay times by 30% per shipment using Ruby, GraphQL, and JavaScript‚Ä¢	Delivered a process implemented with Java and Next.js in WMS(Warehouse Management System) that improves warehouse‚Äôs operational efficiency by enabling the warehouse users to report milestones by scanning cargo/dock doors labels instead of performing manual data entry‚Ä¢	Spearheaded the design and implementation of the 'Holding Shipments' feature in WMS, reducing delay times by 30% per shipment. Developed backend APIs in Java, JOOQ, and gRPC, and created a new UI using Next.js and React
experience.description_html:
• Developed a robust Driver Rejection Visibility Tool using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL, enhancing visibility into driver rejection processes for 1,000+ drivers daily and reducing operational team efforts by 30% per shipment
• Created the Add-Consolidation-Weight Tool using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL, enabling the operations team to add 'consolidation weight' to cargo, leading to a 1% profit increase for 55% of shipments, positively impacting company revenue
• Engineered an AMS (Amsterdam Warehouse) Email Scraper using Ruby on Rails, automating milestone confirmation for shipments at the Amsterdam warehouse and saving 2+ hours per shipment for warehouse users
• Automated confirmation of receipt and departure milestones for over 1,000 Apple shipments daily with Cargo Batch Massive Operation Automation, reducing delay times by 30% per shipment using Ruby, GraphQL, and JavaScript
• Delivered a process implemented with Java and Next.js in WMS(Warehouse Management System) that improves warehouse’s operational efficiency by enabling the warehouse users to report milestones by scanning cargo/dock doors labels instead of performing manual data entry
• Spearheaded the design and implementation of the 'Holding Shipments' feature in WMS, reducing delay times by 30% per shipment. Developed backend APIs in Java, JOOQ, and gRPC, and created a new UI using Next.js and React

experience.description: - Rights Management Team‚Ä¢	Built an internal tool as a full-stack project to do allow list reverse look up on the Rights Management Team which is the biggest platform to protect people‚Äôs copyright for music, video, and pictures‚Ä¢	Designed and implemented three data models to store allow list license data for Rights Manager Product at Facebook by using Hack/PHP, resulting in efficient storage of copyright information of 3 billion users‚Ä¢	Achieved pagination, search, download functionality for this reverse lookup tool by using Hack/PHP, Javascript and React, increasing software engineers‚Äô efficiency working at Meta by 40% and reducing the lookup time by 5 seconds‚Ä¢	Implemented a new UI for allow list feature in Rights Manager Product by writing reusable React components‚Ä¢	Collaborated with Rotation Engineer to write graphQL for reading API to fetch 100 million+  data of new license models ‚Ä¢	Gave 4 presentations to 4 different groups of people, resulting in this internal tool being used and applauded by 4 different teams and 300+ people
experience.description_html:
- Rights Management Team

• Built an internal tool as a full-stack project to do allow list reverse look up on the Rights Management Team which is the biggest platform to protect people’s copyright for music, video, and pictures

• Designed and implemented three data models to store allow list license data for Rights Manager Product at Facebook by using Hack/PHP, resulting in efficient storage of copyright information of 3 billion users

• Achieved pagination, search, download functionality for this reverse lookup tool by using Hack/PHP, Javascript and React, increasing software engineers’ efficiency working at Meta by 40% and reducing the lookup time by 5 seconds

• Implemented a new UI for allow list feature in Rights Manager Product by writing reusable React components

• Collaborated with Rotation Engineer to write graphQL for reading API to fetch 100 million+ data of new license models

• Gave 4 presentations to 4 different groups of people, resulting in this internal tool being used and applauded by 4 different teams and 300+ people
